Package frc.motors

Class AbstractMotorController

java.lang.Object
frc.motors.AbstractMotorController
Direct Known Subclasses:
SparkMotorController, TalonMotorController, VictorMotorController
public abstract class AbstractMotorController
extends java.lang.Object
This is the base class for any motor. It is not an interface because it has to have a nonstatic field which is not doable in an interface. If you are to use a motor that we did not implement, make a new class and use an Abstract motor
Author:
jojo2357
See Also:
AbstractFollowerMotorController, SparkMotorController, TalonMotorController, VictorMotorController

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  AbstractMotorController.SupportedMotors
    This should be one-for-one replicated for each motor controller in order to create settings to switch between motor implementations

  • Field Details

    • motorList

      public static final java.util.ArrayList<AbstractMotorController> motorList

    • sensorToRealDistanceFactor

      public java.lang.Double sensorToRealDistanceFactor
      Value to convert from sensor position to real units (this will vary between motors so know your units!) Destination units are RPM that include the gearing on the motor

      This is a Double (object, not value). If a requiring method is called and s2rf is not set, will throw a NPE, If it is giving you hell and you dont want to actually fix the issue, just change to double (value, not object)

  • Method Details

    • setInverted

      public abstract AbstractMotorController setInverted​(boolean invert)
      Inverts the motor rotation from default for that motor (varies motor to motor of course)
      Parameters:
      invert - Whether to inver the motor or not
      Returns:
      this object (factory style)

    • getName

      public abstract java.lang.String getName()
      The name is a unique motor identifier that includes the motor type and the id
      Returns:
      A unique, identifiable name for this motor

    • resetEncoder

      public abstract void resetEncoder()
      Sets current encoder position to be the zero position. If you are absolutely crazy and want to set the encoder to an artifical position, create an abstract method in AbstractMotorController that takes an position Then, implement this method to call your overloaded method and pass a default of 0. But really dont do that please

    • setPid

      public abstract AbstractMotorController setPid​(PID pid)
      You know how it is. Timeout is default per motor, channel defaults to 0 or motor default
      Parameters:
      pid - the PID object that contains pertinent pidf data
      Returns:
      this object for factory style construction

    • setBrake

      public abstract AbstractMotorController setBrake​(boolean brake)
      Sets the idle mode to either be (brake = false) minimally resistive or (brake = true) to resist all motion/use ERF to slow motor (actual implemetation varies between motors)
      Parameters:
      brake - whether to apply idle resistance
      Returns:
      this object for factory style construction

    • getRotations

      public abstract double getRotations()
      Gets the default encoder's position. Accounts for gearings but not wheelings unless ur crazy and accounted for wheel size in sensorToRealDistanceFactor
      Returns:
      Distance output shaft has moved in rotations

    • getSpeed

      public abstract double getSpeed()
      Gets the current speed of the motor after taking into account s2rf.
      Returns:
      The current speed of the motor

    • setCurrentLimit

      public abstract AbstractMotorController setCurrentLimit​(int limit)
      Sets the maximum allowable current that will flow through this motor
      Parameters:
      limit - max current in amps
      Returns:
      this object for factory style construction

    • setOpenLoopRampRate

      public abstract AbstractMotorController setOpenLoopRampRate​(double timeToMax)
      Sets the ramp rate for open loop control modes. This is the maximum rate at which the motor controller's output is allowed to change in said mode.
      Parameters:
      timeToMax - time in seconds to go from 0 to full power
      Returns:
      this object for factory style construction

    • getSuggestedFix

      public abstract java.lang.String getSuggestedFix()
      Used for issues and gives a potential fix based on built in failure reported issue
      Returns:
      A possible fix to what ails the motor

    • isFailed

      public abstract boolean isFailed()
      Active failure check that uses motor built in failure checks to determine viability of the motor
      Returns:
      true if the motor is failed, false if nominal

    • resetAllMotors

      public static void resetAllMotors()
      In order to prevent out of control PID loops from emerging, especially coming out of a disable in test mde, we set all motors to idle. If we really want them to move then this method will take no effect because

    • moveAtPercent

      public abstract void moveAtPercent​(double percent)
      Sets the motor output on a percent output basis
      Parameters:
      percent - -1 to 1 output requested

    • follow

      public AbstractMotorController follow​(AbstractMotorController leader)
      Have this motor follow another motor (must be the same motor ie talon to talon). This motor will be the child and the passed motor will be the leader
      Parameters:
      leader - motor to follow
      Returns:
      this object for factory style construction
      See Also:
      AbstractFollowerMotorController

    • follow

      public abstract AbstractMotorController follow​(AbstractMotorController leader, boolean invert)
      Have this motor follow another motor (must be the same motor ie talon to talon). This motor will be the child and the passed motor will be the leader
      Parameters:
      leader - motor to follow
      invert - whether to invert this follower
      Returns:
      this object for factory style construction
      See Also:
      AbstractFollowerMotorController

      Parameters:
      s2rf - Conversion from encoder units to RPM including the gearing

    • isTemperatureAcceptable

      protected boolean isTemperatureAcceptable()
      Self explanatory. Takes into account motor temp and DefaultConfig.OVERHEAT_THRESHOLD to determine if the motor is running too hot for usage
      Returns:
      invert isOverheated

    • getMotorTemperature

      public abstract double getMotorTemperature()
      Gets the temperature of the motor
      Returns:
      the temperature in celcius

    • getID

      public abstract int getID()
      Gets the device id based on the motor's built in function. DOES NOT STORE CONSTRUCTED MOTOR ID
      Returns:
      the device id this object controls
